Speech Recognition - Trigger Word Detection

22 September 2020 - less than 1 min read time
Tags: Speech Recognition CNN Keras

In this assignment, my trigger word is “Activate”. Every time it hears you say “activate,” it will make a “chiming” sound. The model will use 1-D convolutional layers, GRU layers, and dense layers, which can be imported from Keras. The following figure shows the detail of the model.

Layer (type)                 Output Shape          Param #   ============================================================ input_1 (InputLayer)         (None, 5511, 101)     0         ____________________ conv1d_1 (Conv1D)            (None, 1375, 196)     297136    ____________________ batch_normalization_1 (Batch (None, 1375, 196)     784       ____________________ activation_1 (Activation)    (None, 1375, 196)     0         ____________________ dropout_1 (Dropout)          (None, 1375, 196)     0         ____________________ gru_1 (GRU)                  (None, 1375, 128)     124800    ____________________ dropout_2 (Dropout)          (None, 1375, 128)     0         ____________________ batch_normalization_2 (Batch (None, 1375, 128)     512       ____________________ gru_2 (GRU)                  (None, 1375, 128)     98688     ____________________ dropout_3 (Dropout)          (None, 1375, 128)     0         ____________________ batch_normalization_3 (Batch (None, 1375, 128)     512       ____________________ dropout_4 (Dropout)          (None, 1375, 128)     0         ____________________ time_distributed_1 (TimeDist (None, 1375, 1)       129       ============================================================ Total params: 522,561 Trainable params: 521,657 Non-trainable params: 904   Finally, the development set accuracy I got for the trigger word detection problem is 94.56%.

with by Kaiqi Cheng
